oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Austrian-made .58 musket and bayonet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: .58 caliber Austrian musket and bayonet. The Confederate and Union armies both imported these during the war. The musket is missing part of the back site. The stock is beechwood. There are undeciperable markings ("KG"" on the cheekpiece on the stock. The bayonet is four-sided, which is unique to the Austrian bayonet.
